description: Redesign the Dojo marketing website to match pitch deck aesthetics (dark theme, cyan accents) and drive creator/learner signups

userStories.title: Implement dark theme design system
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a design system with dark theme and cyan/teal accents so all pages have consistent Dojo branding.
acceptanceCriteria: Update Tailwind config with Dojo color palette (dark backgrounds #0a0a0a/#111, cyan accents #00d4ff/#22d3ee)
Create CSS variables for consistent theming across components
Update existing marketing components to use new color scheme
Ensure sufficient contrast ratios for accessibility (WCAG AA)
userStories.notes: Design system was already implemented in globals.css with .dojo theme class

userStories.title: Redesign marketing navbar with login link
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want a clear navigation bar so I can explore the site and access login.
acceptanceCriteria: Dojo logo (lowercase 'dojo' text) on the left
Navigation links: How It Works, For Creators, For Learners, About
Login text link on the right that navigates to /auth/login
Get Early Access primary CTA button (cyan accent)
Sticky navbar on scroll with subtle backdrop blur
userStories.notes: Navbar was already implemented in marketing-navbar.tsx with all acceptance criteria met

userStories.title: Build homepage hero section with audience toggle
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to immediately understand what Dojo does and see content relevant to my role (creator or learner).
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle switch: I'm a Creator / I'm a Learner
Dynamic headline that changes based on toggle selection
Creator view: Turn Your Expertise Into Income + creator-focused subheadline
Learner view: Master Any Skill in Minutes a Day + learner-focused subheadline
Primary CTA changes: Apply as Creator vs Join Waitlist
Floating social proof elements (stats, metrics) around hero
Background with subtle gradient/glow effects matching pitch deck
userStories.notes: Hero section redesigned with audience toggle, dynamic content, social proof stats, and gradient effects

userStories.title: Create features grid section
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand Dojo's key features so I can evaluate if it's right for me.
acceptanceCriteria: Section headline: The First Marketplace Powered By Cognitive Scaffolding
6 feature cards in responsive grid (3x2 desktop, 2x3 tablet, 1x6 mobile)
Features: Universal Scaffolding, Feed-to-Mastery Funnel, AI-Powered Repurposing, Peer-Reviewed Discovery, Native Monetization, Low-Friction Mastery
Each card: icon, title, description, subtle border glow on hover
Dark card backgrounds with cyan accent borders
userStories.notes: Created DojoFeaturesSection component with 6 feature cards, responsive grid layout, motion animations, and hover glow effects

userStories.title: Build How It Works visual flow section
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see how the Dojo engine transforms content so I understand the product's value.
acceptanceCriteria: Three-step visual flow: Input (video icons) -> Dojo Engine (processing steps) -> Output (micro-lesson card)
Process steps: Semantic Segmentation, Pedagogical Labeling, Synthesis Optimization
Dark background with glowing accent elements
userStories.notes: Created HowItWorksSection component with three-step visual flow (Input -> Dojo Engine -> Output), animated arrows, responsive layout (horizontal desktop, vertical mobile)

userStories.title: Create competitive differentiation section
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand how Dojo compares to alternatives so I can see its unique value.
acceptanceCriteria: Comparison points vs: Skillshare/Udemy, Duolingo, TikTok, MasterClass
Format: What they do well -> What Dojo adds
Visual treatment: dark cards with subtle glow effects
userStories.notes: Created WhyDojoSection component with 4 competitor comparison cards (Skillshare/Udemy, Duolingo, TikTok, MasterClass), each showing what they do well and what Dojo adds

userStories.title: Build creator application form section
userStories.description: As a creator, I want to apply to join Dojo so I can start monetizing my expertise.
acceptanceCriteria: Section headline: Apply as a Creator
Form fields: Full Name, Email, Content Niche (dropdown), Social Profile Link, Monthly Audience Size
Store submissions in Supabase table: creator_applications

userStories.title: Build learner waitlist form section
userStories.description: As a learner, I want to join the waitlist so I get notified when Dojo launches.
acceptanceCriteria: Form fields: Email, Name (optional), Interests (multi-select: Fitness, Music, Makeup, Other)
Success state: You're on the list message
Store submissions in Supabase table: learner_waitlist

userStories.title: Create dedicated For Creators page
userStories.description: As a creator, I want a dedicated page explaining creator benefits so I can evaluate joining Dojo.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero: Turn Your Expertise Into Scalable Income
Value props: 70% revenue share, AI handles course structure, reach learners through feed, real-time analytics
The Creator Struggle problem statement from pitch deck

userStories.title: Create dedicated For Learners page
userStories.description: As a learner, I want a dedicated page explaining learner benefits so I can evaluate using Dojo.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero: Master Any Skill, One Swipe at a Time
Value props: Bite-sized micro-lessons, learn from real practitioners, peer-reviewed quality, free to mastery path
The Consumer Struggle problem statement from pitch deck

userStories.title: Create How It Works page
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want a detailed explanation of how Dojo works so I can understand the platform deeply.
acceptanceCriteria: Sections: The Dojo Engine, For Creators flow, For Learners flow, The Marketplace Loop
Visual diagrams matching pitch deck style
CTAs at bottom for both creators and learners

userStories.title: Update About page with founder info
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to learn about the team so I can trust the company.
acceptanceCriteria: Founder section: Jack Modesett bio (Ares Capital, InSite Property Group, UCSB)

userStories.title: Build marketing footer
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want a footer with navigation and legal links so I can find information and contact the company.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation columns: Product (How It Works, For Creators, For Learners), Company (About, Blog), Legal (Terms, Privacy)
Dark background consistent with site theme

userStories.title: Create Supabase tables for form submissions
userStories.description: As a developer, I need database tables to store creator applications and learner waitlist signups.
acceptanceCriteria: Table: creator_applications (id, created_at, name, email, niche, social_link, audience_size, status)
Table: learner_waitlist (id, created_at, email, name, interests)
Email uniqueness constraint on both tables
userStories.notes: This can be done anytime but should be ready before forms are connected

userStories.title: Add page transitions and micro-interactions
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want smooth animations so the site feels polished and premium.
acceptanceCriteria: Page fade-in transitions using motion library
Scroll-triggered animations for sections (fade up on enter)
Button hover states with subtle glow effects
Card hover states with border glow

userStories.title: Implement responsive design across all pages
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the site to work perfectly on my device so I can learn about Dojo anywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: Verify in browser at multiple viewport sizes

userStories.title: SEO and metadata optimization
userStories.description: As a marketer, I want proper SEO so the site ranks well in search results.
acceptanceCriteria: Update root metadata with Dojo branding
Unique title and description for each page
Open Graph images for social sharing
